A single serving of a soft drink can contain up to 10 teaspoons of sugar and over 200 calories. An apple, on the other hand, contains almost no sugar and has about 85 calories. A slice of bread contains roughly 200 calories, while a chocolate chip cookie can contain up to 300 calories. Cheese is the least energy-rich food item, with only 5-6 grams of fat per ounce.

user_query: what percentage of the united states population suffers from depression ?
alpaca-7b_response: According to research published in The American Journal of Psychiatry, the rate of major depression for American adults increased from 3.33 percent to 7.06 percent from 1991 to 2002. The World Health Organization also reports that depression is a worldwide epidemic, with 5 percent of the global population suffering from the condition. Depression comes in different forms, including major depressive disorder, dysthymia, and bipolar disorder. Symptoms of depression can include feeling hopeless or empty, having low energy, difficulty concentrating, sleeping too much or too little, and having low self-esteem. If you or someone you know is suffering from depression, it is important to seek help from a mental health professional.
